item.title: Comment on Memories by Cynthia Hopper
item.dc:creator: Cynthia Hopper
item.description: Nell was my great-aunt, being my grand-mother's only sister. She did something very special for me.....only a handful of years ago. I was having a very difficult time getting pregnant, was getting older, and did not want to use any of the fertility treatments. Out of the blue, I get a phone call from Aunt Nell. It's like she just knew that I needed to talk to a mother figure. My mother had passed, grandmother, it's as if she just knew I needed her. I had never really talked with her before that day, She expressed to me that when you quit worrying yourself about getting pregnant, it will happen. I now have that daughter she told me I would have. She will be 6 this year. I will have the other, she told me I would have, this February. At that time she expressed to me that I should come and visit. I wish I would have made it down there. My memory of her, from when I was young, was of her and my grandmother fussing lol. They were very respectful when doing it. The next minute they were joyfully laughing over something smart one of them had said. My more recent memory of her, is of her genuine concern for others. She was kind, compassionate, and knew how to comfort those around her with words and feelings. She was a special lady, and I know that she will be greatly missed.
item.content:encoded: Nell was my great-aunt, being my grand-mother’s only sister. She did something very special for me…..only a handful of years ago. I was having a very difficult time getting pregnant, was getting older, and did not want to use any of the fertility treatments. Out of the blue, I get a phone call from Aunt Nell. It’s like she just knew that I needed to talk to a mother figure. My mother had passed, grandmother, it’s as if she just knew I needed her. I had never really talked with her before that day, She expressed to me that when you quit worrying yourself about getting pregnant, it will happen. I now have that daughter she told me I would have. She will be 6 this year. I will have the other, she told me I would have, this February. At that time she expressed to me that I should come and visit. I wish I would have made it down there. My memory of her, from when I was young, was of her and my grandmother fussing lol. They were very respectful when doing it. The next minute they were joyfully laughing over something smart one of them had said. My more recent memory of her, is of her genuine concern for others. She was kind, compassionate, and knew how to comfort those around her with words and feelings. She was a special lady, and I know that she will be greatly missed.

item.title: Comment on Memories by Jennifer McCammond
item.dc:creator: Jennifer McCammond
item.description: I wake up every morning and realize you are not here with us. The world does not seem the same even though I know you are happy with our Lord. I miss you so much.
item.content:encoded: I wake up every morning and realize you are not here with us. The world does not seem the same even though I know you are happy with our Lord. I miss you so much.

item.title: Comment on Memories by Caroline III Maxwell
item.dc:creator: Caroline III Maxwell
item.description:
Nell, faithful and wonderful friend,
What a source of great strength you were (and still are). Your sense of values and abiding faith in God has been so wonderful for you and your family.
Love Forever, Caroline
*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*
item.content:encoded:
Nell, faithful and wonderful friend,

What a source of great strength you were (and still are). Your sense of values and abiding faith in God has been so wonderful for you and your family.

Love Forever,
Caroline

*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*

item.title: Comment on Memories by Ellen Barton
item.dc:creator: Ellen Barton
item.description:
Mrs. Hayward is a such a blessing to me. She and I both attended West Pensacola Baptist Church in 1990's-2001, and then we went to MGBC. We did vacation bible school together. She was a loving person. She loved to teach the kids. We will miss her dearly.
Thank you, Nell. God bless, and I love you.
*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*
item.content:encoded:
Mrs. Hayward is a such a blessing to me. She and I both attended West Pensacola Baptist Church in 1990’s-2001, and then we went to MGBC. We did vacation bible school together. She was a loving person. She loved to teach the kids. We will miss her dearly.

Thank you, Nell. God bless, and I love you.

*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*

item.title: Comment on Memories by Wanda D.
item.dc:creator: Wanda D.
item.description:
Nell and I worked together in children's ministry. The kids loved her and haven't forgotten her. Knowing her was an honor.
Wanda D.
*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*
item.content:encoded:
Nell and I worked together in children’s ministry. The kids loved her and haven’t forgotten her. Knowing her was an honor.

Wanda D.

*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*

item.title: Comment on Memories by Sandra Qualls M.
item.dc:creator: Sandra Qualls M.
item.description:
Aunt Nell was a huge part of my childhood. I spent many summers with her, and I also kept Jenny, Jeff, and Julie as kids. We will miss her much.
*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*
item.content:encoded:
Aunt Nell was a huge part of my childhood. I spent many summers with her, and I also kept Jenny, Jeff, and Julie as kids. We will miss her much.

item.title: Comment on Memories by Cindy Qualls Leonard
item.dc:creator: Cindy Qualls Leonard
item.description:
Aunt Nell,
You were so helpful to me when I started learning about my Qualls lineage. You shared photos and memories with me.
Love Always, Cindy Qualls Leonard
*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*
item.content:encoded:
Aunt Nell,

You were so helpful to me when I started learning about my Qualls lineage. You shared photos and memories with me.

Cindy Qualls Leonard

item.title: Comment on Memories by Kathy Lawrence
item.dc:creator: Kathy Lawrence
item.description:
Mrs. Nell (Mama)
The BEST Mother-in-law anyone could ever ask for! I have so many GREAT memories...a mother and woman that will be missed by all that knew her!
*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*

Most Sincerely, Irina, Dunayeus, Marina, Lidia

item.title: Comment on Memories by Bobbie Skinner
item.dc:creator: Bobbie Skinner
item.description:
Ms. Nell was loved greatly by all those children to whom she taught the love of "Jesus."
My daughter Roberta loved going into her Sunday School class each and every Sunday morning.
We loved her.
*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*
item.content:encoded:
Ms. Nell was loved greatly by all those children to whom she taught the love of “Jesus.”

My daughter Roberta loved going into her Sunday School class each and every Sunday morning.

We loved her.

*This entry was transcribed from hand written memory card.*
